supporting_text: The NAP outlines a One Health approach that integrates human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific actions aimed at improving human health outcomes related to antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP addresses animal health through targeted strategies to reduce antimicrobial use in livestock.
The NAP includes actions focused on environmental protection and reducing AMR in environmental contexts.
The NAP outlines strategies to promote sustainable agricultural practices that minimize AMR risks.
The NAP specifies the establishment of a reporting mechanism to monitor progress on its objectives.
The NAP sets specific targets with deadlines to measure progress in combating AMR.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and monitoring antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines budget allocations for various strategies aimed at addressing AMR.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for its proposed activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral task force to coordinate AMR efforts across sectors.
The NAP includes actions aimed at enhancing the legislative framework governing antimicrobial use.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of training and educational initiatives to raise awareness about AMR.
The NAP outlines plans for public awareness campaigns to engage communities in combating AMR.
The NAP highlights the importance of international collaboration with organizations like WHO and FAO.
The NAP includes strategies for enhancing data collection and surveillance systems for AMR.
The NAP outlines actions to strengthen capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance patterns.
The NAP includes specific strategies for sanitation and infection prevention to combat AMR.
The NAP commits to implementing international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes actions to engage in international research collaborations for AMR solutions.
